backend.forms.deductions.donations_hint: Documented donations to eligible charities qualify for the statutory tax credit (retain official receipts).
backend.forms.deductions.education_hint: Eligible tuition or tutoring expenses for dependents with official receipts; statutory caps apply.
backend.forms.deductions.insurance_hint: Life and health insurance premiums paid to authorised providers with receipts (deduction limits apply).
backend.forms.deductions.medical_hint: Out-of-pocket medical, hospital, and pharmacy costs with receipts; deductible amounts follow AADE limits.
backend.forms.dependents.children_allowance.desc: Automatic tax credits applied to salary and pension income based on dependent children.
backend.forms.dependents.children_allowance.thre: Plus €220 for each additional child beyond three.
backend.forms.dependents.children_hint: Count dependent children who qualify for the AADE family tax credit (typically under 18, full-time students up to 24, or children with a disability). Impacts salary and pension tax credits.
backend.hints.toggles.new_mother.description: Flag recent childbirth to surface AADE guidance on enhanced family credits and presumptive relief.
backend.hints.toggles.new_mother.label: New mother allowance
backend.hints.toggles.small_village.description: Available to residents of settlements under 500 inhabitants; may reduce presumptive income imputation.
backend.hints.toggles.small_village.label: Small village residency relief
backend.hints.toggles.youth_eligibility.descript: Toggle if the worker qualifies for the reduced youth rates (under 25 or age 26–30 entering the workforce).

calculator.heading: Tax calculator
calculator.instructions_intro: Work through the sections you enable, using the hints to enter annual or per-payment figures, then select Calculate to generate your summary.
calculator.results_intro: Results Summary: The chart and tables below show your total income, taxes, and net income. Hover over the diagram for details and review each category in the list.
calculator.results_social_note: Net pay honours your social insurance selection. Leave the toggle on to subtract EFKA contributions automatically, or turn it off to see a tax-only projection.
calculator.results_employer_note: Employer cost represents the gross salary plus employer EFKA contributions, capped at the statutory salary ceiling.

hints.children-eligibility: Count dependent children recognised for the AADE family tax credit (minors, students up to 24, or dependents with a disability).
hints.employment-employee-contributions: Add EFKA amounts you pay directly outside payroll (for example, voluntary top-ups). Most employees will leave this at 0 because payroll already covers EFKA.
hints.agricultural-professional-farmer: Check this if you are registered as a professional farmer for the tax year. It enables any reliefs available for that status.
hints.employment-income: Enter the total gross salary for the year when you have a single annual figure.
hints.employment-include-social: Untick to see tax-only net income. EFKA amounts (employee and employer) will be treated as zero in the results.
hints.employment-monthly-income: Enter the gross amount per payslip (monthly or bonus). The calculator multiplies it by your payments per year.
hints.employment-net-note: Net-to-gross salary conversion isn't supported. Choose annual or per-payment mode above and provide gross amounts only.
hints.employment-payments: Most salaried roles use 14 payments (12 monthly plus bonuses). Adjust this to match the number of payslips you receive each year.
hints.pension-section-intro: If you receive a pension, fill in the fields below; otherwise leave them blank.
hints.employment-withholding: Enter PAYE income tax already withheld on your payslips to reduce the balance due.
hints.income-toggle-intro: Select each income type you receive to reveal its inputs.
hints.other-income: Include taxable amounts such as unemployment benefits, alimony received, taxable scholarships, prizes, or other income not covered above.
hints.freelance-activity-start-year: Determines if the new-business 5-year fee exemption applies.
hints.freelance-efka-category: Select a contribution class to prefill mandatory EFKA payments.
hints.freelance-efka-summary-empty: Select a contribution class to view monthly pension, health, and auxiliary amounts.
hints.freelance-expenses: Claim only expenses backed by invoices (rent, utilities, professional fees, equipment, vehicle costs used for business).
hints.freelance-revenue: Report gross turnover before VAT or withholding taxes.
hints.freelance-trade-fee-location: Standard areas pay the full business activity fee; reduced areas pay half in eligible small towns or islands.
hints.freelance-trade-fee-new: Reduced rate applies for the first {{years}} years of activity.
hints.freelance-trade-fee-new-eligible: Based on your start year, the reduced amount applies for this tax year.
hints.freelance-trade-fee-new-expired: The reduced-rate window has ended (more than {{years}} years of activity).
hints.freelance-trade-fee-sunset: The business activity fee is slated to return from {{year}} (status: {{status}}). Double-check the latest rules with your accountant.
hints.freelance-trade-fee-waived: No business activity fee is due for this tax year, so you can leave this switched off.
hints.pension-income-gross: Use the gross field when you know the annual pension before deductions.
hints.pension-income-net: Enter the annual net pension only when you choose "Total for year" above.
hints.pension-income-net-monthly: Enter the per-payment net pension only when you choose "Per payment" above.
hints.pension-net-input-mode: Choose whether to enter the total net amount for the year or the net amount for each payment.
hints.year-partial-note: If you didn't earn income for the full year, enter what you earned; the annual tax credit still applies in full.

ui.deductions_help_body: Only enter amounts supported by official receipts or payment slips.
ui.deductions_help_limits: Statutory limits are applied automatically—donation credits depend on income, while medical, education, and insurance costs follow AADE caps.
ui.disclaimer: Disclaimer: This tool is unofficial and provided as-is. Inputs are stored locally on your device for up to two hours and are never sent to a server. Please consult a professional accountant for formal filings.
ui.freelance_help_body: Report gross turnover before VAT and only claim expenses you can document (rent, utilities, equipment, professional fees).
ui.freelance_help_contributions: Choosing an EFKA category preloads mandatory contributions; override with your actual payments if they differ.
ui.freelance_mandatory_tooltip: Mandatory EFKA and auxiliary contributions reduce taxable profit euro-for-euro when supported by receipts.
ui.highlight_inputs_copy: Toggle each income type only when you need it, supported by inline tips and validation.
ui.highlight_localisation_copy: Use the top-right language buttons to switch between English and Greek without losing your data.
ui.highlight_visual_copy: Track taxes, contributions, and take-home pay through a colour-coded Sankey diagram.
ui.overview_description: Follow these quick steps to receive a bilingual summary of your Greek income taxes.
ui.overview_step_calculate: Press Calculate to view your results and download a copy.
ui.overview_step_enter_values: Enter the amounts requested for each active section.
ui.overview_step_select_year: Choose the tax year and confirm the language above.
ui.overview_step_toggle_sections: Enable the income sections that match your situation.
ui.tagline: Unofficial tax estimation toolkit for Greece
